tasks.title: Implement Immediate Local Save for Data Values
tasks.description: Ensure any change to a data value field is immediately saved to the local Room database using DataValueDraftDao.
tasks.details: Modify the DataEntryViewModel's updateCurrentValue function to call the upsertDraft method of DataValueDraftDao for every field change. Ensure the function is the single source of truth for this action.
tasks.testStrategy: Test by entering data in various fields and verifying the data is saved in the local database immediately. Check for consistency and performance impact.

subtasks.title: Modify updateCurrentValue function signature
subtasks.description: Update the function signature to include necessary parameters for database operations
subtasks.details: Add DataValueDraftDao as a parameter to the updateCurrentValue function in DataEntryViewModel to enable database operations. Ensure the function can receive and process the new data value.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit test to verify the function signature changes and parameter handling

subtasks.title: Implement upsertDraft call in updateCurrentValue
subtasks.description: Integrate the upsertDraft method call within the updateCurrentValue function
subtasks.details: Inside the updateCurrentValue function, call the upsertDraft method of DataValueDraftDao with the new data value. Ensure the call is made immediately after the value is updated.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit test to verify the upsertDraft method is called with correct parameters

subtasks.title: Handle database operation results
subtasks.description: Implement error handling and success feedback for the database operation
subtasks.details: Add error handling around the upsertDraft call to manage potential database exceptions. Provide feedback to the user if the operation fails.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit test to simulate and verify error handling scenarios

subtasks.title: Ensure single source of truth
subtasks.description: Verify that updateCurrentValue is the only function modifying the data value
subtasks.details: Review the codebase to ensure no other functions are modifying the data value directly. Refactor any such instances to use updateCurrentValue.
subtasks.testStrategy: Code review and integration testing to ensure consistency

subtasks.title: Optimize performance
subtasks.description: Ensure the immediate save operation does not degrade performance
subtasks.details: Profile the updateCurrentValue function to ensure the database operation does not cause noticeable delays. Consider using background threads if necessary.
subtasks.testStrategy: Performance testing to measure and optimize execution time

tasks.title: Enable Offline Data Entry and Editing
tasks.description: Ensure all data entry and editing functionalities work without an internet connection.
tasks.details: Verify that all UI components and backend logic function correctly in offline mode. Ensure no network-dependent operations are triggered during offline usage.
tasks.testStrategy: Test the app in airplane mode to confirm all functionalities remain operational without network connectivity.

tasks.title: Hydrate Data from Local Drafts on Screen Load
tasks.description: Load existing drafts from the local database when opening a data entry screen, prioritizing them over server data.
tasks.details: Implement logic in the EditEntryScreen to fetch and display local drafts for the current dataset instance before fetching from the server.
tasks.testStrategy: Test by creating drafts offline and verifying they load correctly when reopening the screen, even with server data available.

subtasks.title: Create Local Draft Database Table
subtasks.description: Design and implement a local database table to store draft entries.
subtasks.details: Define the schema for the drafts table including fields like entry_id, data, timestamp, and sync_status. Implement the table creation in the local database using SQLite or similar.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify table creation with schema validation tests and basic CRUD operation tests.

subtasks.title: Implement Draft Fetching Logic
subtasks.description: Create a function to fetch drafts from the local database for a specific dataset instance.
subtasks.details: Write a function in the data access layer that queries the local database for drafts matching the current dataset instance ID. The function should return the draft data if found.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test with mock data to ensure correct retrieval of drafts by dataset instance ID.

subtasks.title: Integrate Draft Fetching in Screen Load
subtasks.description: Modify the EditEntryScreen to fetch and display local drafts on load.
subtasks.details: In the EditEntryScreen's initialization logic, call the draft fetching function before making any server requests. If a draft exists, populate the UI with the draft data.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test screen behavior with and without existing drafts to ensure proper prioritization and display.

subtasks.title: Handle Server Data Fetching Fallback
subtasks.description: Implement logic to fetch from the server if no local draft exists.
subtasks.details: If no local draft is found, proceed with the existing server data fetching logic. Ensure the UI transitions smoothly between draft and server data states.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test scenarios with no local drafts to verify server data is fetched and displayed correctly.

subtasks.title: Add Draft Management UI Indicators
subtasks.description: Add visual indicators to show when a draft is being displayed.
subtasks.details: Implement UI elements (e.g., a banner or icon) to inform users they are viewing a local draft. Include options to clear or save the draft.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify UI indicators appear correctly when drafts are loaded and test draft management options.

tasks.title: Implement User-Triggered Sync Button
tasks.description: Convert the 'Save' FAB into a 'Save & Sync' button with network-aware functionality.
tasks.details: Update the FAB to check network connectivity and trigger the sync process. Use d2.dataValueModule().dataValues().blockingUpload() for online sync.
tasks.testStrategy: Test sync functionality in both online and offline modes, verifying the correct behavior and feedback.

tasks.title: Add Sync Feedback UI
tasks.description: Provide visual feedback during and after the sync process.
tasks.details: Add a loading indicator to the sync button and display Snackbar messages for success/failure. Include user-friendly error messages.
tasks.testStrategy: Test sync feedback by simulating successful and failed syncs, ensuring the UI updates appropriately.

tasks.title: Implement Unsaved Changes Dialog
tasks.description: Warn users when navigating away with unsaved changes.
tasks.details: Add a confirmation dialog with options to save, discard, or cancel when unsaved changes are detected.
tasks.testStrategy: Test by attempting to navigate away with unsaved data and verifying the dialog appears and functions correctly.

tasks.title: Add 'Complete' Button and Workflow
tasks.description: Introduce a 'Complete' button to finalize data entry.
tasks.details: Add the button to the EditEntryScreen and implement the workflow to sync data and mark the instance as complete using d2.dataSetModule().dataSetCompleteness().set().
tasks.testStrategy: Test the completion workflow, ensuring data syncs before completion and the UI updates accordingly.

subtasks.title: Validate Data Grouping Logic
subtasks.description: Ensure the logic grouping data into accordion sections is correct and stable.
subtasks.details:
Review the data grouping logic in DataEntryViewModel. Ensure grouped data is consistent and correctly mapped to accordion sections. Add logging or validation checks if needed.
<info added on 2025-06-17T07:13:04.595Z>
Validated data grouping logic in DataEntryViewModel:

- Logic is stable when sectionName is unique and consistent

subtasks.title: Handle State Restoration on Configuration Changes
subtasks.description: Ensure the accordion state is restored correctly when the app undergoes configuration changes (e.g., screen rotation).
subtasks.details:
Implement onSaveInstanceState and onRestoreInstanceState in the activity/fragment to save and restore the expanded/collapsed state from the ViewModel. Alternatively, use ViewModel's built-in state retention.
<info added on 2025-06-17T07:13:59.088Z>
Accordion state restoration is now handled by DataEntryViewModel using StateFlow, which automatically preserves expanded/collapsed states during configuration changes without requiring onSaveInstanceState/onRestoreInstanceState implementations. The ViewModel's lifecycle-aware state management ensures consistent behavior across screen rotations. Testing confirmed state preservation after expanding/collapsing sections and rotating the screen. UI state is now fully managed by the ViewModel with no local UI state tracking needed for expansion.
</info added on 2025-06-17T07:13:59.088Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Test by expanding/collapsing sections, rotating the screen, and verifying the state is restored correctly.
